Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure confronting goat and panther (of ruminating goat, part of head, ear, antler and neck remaining; trace of added red on neck; of panther, chest belly and forlegs remaining; trace of red on chest and shoulder); glazed below with added red band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.198) (phase 3)
